contentrichtext.text: {{Taxobox | name = Prickly Skink Lizard | regnum = [[Animal]]ia | phylum = [[Chordata]] | classis = [[Reptilia]] <small>([[paraphyletic]])</small> | unranked_ordo = [[Sauria]] | ordo = [[Squamata]] <small>([[paraphyletic]])</small> | infraordo = [[Scincomorpha]] | familia = [[Scincidae]] | subfamilia = [[Lygosominae]] | genus = '''''Gnypetoscincus''''' | genus_authority = | species = '''''G. queenslandiae''''' | binomial = ''Gnypetoscincus queenslandiae'' | binomial_authority = }} '''''Gnypetoscincus''''' is a [[monotypic]] [[genus]] of [[skink]]s ([[family (biology)|family]] Scincidae). It contains a [[Monotypic taxon|single species]], the '''Prickly Skink''', (''Gnypetoscincus queenslandiae''). These [[skinks]] have rough, keeled [[Scale_(zoology)|scales]], unlike the skin of most small skinks which tends to be smooth. They are found only in tropical north [[Queensland]]. It belongs to a [[clade]] in the ''[[Sphenomorphus]]'' group which contains such genera as ''[[Ctenotus]]'' and ''[[Anomalopus]]''. Even closer to the Prickly Skink seems the genus ''[[Eulamprus]]''.(Austin & Arnold 2006) ==References== * {{aut|Austin, J.J. & Arnold, E.N.}} (2006): Using ancient and recent DNA to explore relationships of extinct and endangered ''Leiolopisma'' skinks (Reptilia: Scincidae) in the Mascarene islands. ''Molecular Phylogenetics and Evolution'' '''39'''(2): 503â€“511. <small>{{doi|10.1016/j.ympev.2005.12.011}}</small> (HTML abstract) ==External links== *http://www.wildherps.com/species/G.queenslandiae.html {{skink-stub}} [[Category:Skinks]] [[Category:Monotypic reptile genera]]
